item.title: How to View Files in an RPM Package on Linux
item.description: Quick guide to inspecting the contents of RPM packages and determining which packages own specific files on your Linux system.
item.dc:creator: Pablo Caro

item.title: TCP Connection States in GNU/Linux: netstat and ss
item.description: Understand the different TCP connection states reported by netstat and ss, from establishment to termination, for better network diagnosis.
item.dc:creator: Pablo Caro

item.title: Kitty as a Quick Access Terminal: The Convenience of a Dropdown
item.description: Configure Kitty for instant and efficient access, combining the power of a modern terminal with the convenience of a dropdown.
item.dc:creator: Pablo Caro

item.title: Essential Keyboard Shortcuts in Kitty: Mastering Your Terminal
item.description: A quick guide to the most useful Kitty keyboard shortcuts to optimize your command-line workflow.
item.dc:creator: Pablo Caro

item.title: From Yakuake to Kitty: My Transition to a Modern Terminal
item.description: Exploring the reasons and benefits of switching from Yakuake to Kitty for a more powerful and customizable terminal experience.
item.dc:creator: Pablo Caro

item.title: Middle click in firefox
item.description: Stop firefox from opening the pasted url with the middle mouse button
item.dc:creator: Pablo Caro

item.title: NetHogs see consumed bandwidth
item.description:
To measure the bandwidth I am using right now, I use NetHogs

By default, it looks for a network interface called "eth0". If it doesn't find it, it complains like this:

ioctl failed while establishing local IP for selected device eth0. You may specify the device on the command line â€¦
item.dc:creator: Pablo Caro
